entry.title: BBC Sportsound pundit raves about Celtic after routing Aberdeen with two standouts highlighted
entry.summary: Former Celtic goalkeeper Packie Bonner hailed Celtic's character after an incredible 6-0 win against Aberdeen saw the Bhoys go eight points clear at the top of the Scottish Premiership. Celtic dominated Aberdeen from start to finish in their biggest win of the season despite the announcement of Daizen Maeda's injury on Friday. Hyunjun Yang opened the scoring for Celtic just nine minutes into the game, with Kyogo Furuhashi adding another after 16 minutes. Although they had to wait just over 60 minutes for their third goal, the Bhoys were clearly the dominant side and could have won the game by an even greater margin. The post BBC Sportsound pundit raves about Celtic after routing Aberdeen with two standouts highlighted appeared first on 67 Hail Hail.

entry.title: Kolo Toure's brilliant comments on Celtic in new interview
entry.summary: Former Celtic defender Kolo Toure has revealed he knew that Celtic would go unbeaten in the 2016/17 season. Toure also went unbeaten in the 2003/04 Premier League with Arsenal, making him a historic player for having gone unbeaten in seasons with Celtic and Arsenal, an incredible feat which neither side has since been able to replicate. The post Kolo Toure's brilliant comments on Celtic in new interview appeared first on 67 Hail Hail.

entry.title: Celtic transfer target sounds ready for a change of club
entry.summary: Andriy Lunin's wife Anastasia has provided an update on her husband's future at Real Madrid with the Ukrainian shot stopper linked with a move to Celtic. Lunin, who joined Real Madrid in 2018, has failed to secure a spot as the number one goalkeeper during his time at the club. He was said to be disappointed with the summer signing of Kepa Arrizabalaga on loan from Chelsea after a training ground injury to Thibaut Courtois. The post Celtic transfer target sounds ready for a change of club appeared first on 67 Hail Hail.

entry.title: ‘GET RID OF IT,’ RODGERS’ VAR VERDICT
entry.summary: BRENDAN RODGERS has revealed he “would get rid of it” when asked his opinion of VAR. Celtic were on the receiving end when Daizen Maeda was dismissed in the first-half of the 6-0 Champions League loss against Atletico Madrid in the Metropolitano Stadium in midweek. The Japanese international forward was booked for looked like an innocous [...]

entry.title: Celtic boss makes bold comments on refereeing
entry.summary: Celtic manager Brendan Rodgers has urged for VAR to be abandoned criticizing the way it is used to referee matches. Rodgers' comments follow Daizen Maeda's red card against Atletico Madrid on Tuesday, which left Celtic down to 10 men for the majority of the match. The post Celtic boss makes bold comments on refereeing appeared first on 67 Hail Hail.

entry.title: CELTIC JINX STRIKES AGAIN
entry.summary: DAIZEN MAEDA is latest first-teamer to be hit by the injury jinx that has severely disrupted Celtic since the start of the season. The Japanese winger is out for around a month and a half and joins his fellow-countryman Reo Hatate and winger Liel Abada while Maik Nawrocki, the £4.3million recruit from Legia Warsaw in [...]

entry.title: John Hartson says a lot of things "conspired against Celtic" this week
entry.summary: Former Celtic striker John Hartson has defended Daizen Maeda after his sending off on Tuesday night against Atletico Madrid, even describing the sending off as harsh. Hartson spoke of the negative effect the red card had on Tuesday's match, which meant that Atletico were able to take full advantage of gaps all over the pitch with Celtic down to 10 men Atletico scored five goals after Maeda's sending off. The post John Hartson says a lot of things "conspired against Celtic" this week appeared first on 67 Hail Hail.

entry.title: Ange Postecoglou makes Celtic claim to Rio Ferdinand
entry.summary: Ange Postecoglou might have stayed just two years at Celtic before leaving for Tottenham Hotspur, but he certainly left his mark at Parkhead, winning five trophies during that period of time. So much so that even a proven winner like Brendan Rodgers has struggled to replicate that sort of form at the start of this […] Ange Postecoglou makes Celtic claim to Rio Ferdinand - The Celtic Bhoys - The Celtic Bhoys - Celtic FC News, Transfer Rumours and Fan Community

entry.title: Former Bhoys defender questions Brendan Rodgers' tactics after red card in 6-0 loss
entry.summary: Former Celtic defender Mark Wilson has questioned Brendan Rodgers' tactics following Daizen Maeda's sending off against Atletico Madrid on Tuesday. Maeda was sent off in the 23rd minute, and Rodgers decided against making any substitutions until half-time despite being down to 10 men. Instead, the Northern Irishman employed a 4-3-2 formation with Luis Palma and Kyogo Furuhashi up front for the Bhoys. The post Former Bhoys defender questions Brendan Rodgers' tactics after red card in 6-0 loss appeared first on 67 Hail Hail.
